description:
On kilo master detaching iscsi lvm block volumes fails to remove luns on nova cpu host

How to reproduce with lvm backend
Ubuntu 14.04
clone devstack 
Create volume1_lvm volume type lvmdriver-1
Attach volume1_lvm to nova nst1
ll /dev/disk/by-path/
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root   9 Mar  4 12:59 ip-10.50.128.22:3260-iscsi-iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-45451822-f305-406c-9eec-088b7e432af5-lun-1 -> ../../sdg

Dettach volume1_lvm
ll /dev/disk/by-path/
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root   9 Mar  4 12:59 ip-10.50.128.22:3260-iscsi-iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-45451822-f305-406c-9eec-088b7e432af5-lun-1 -> ../../sdg

Seems to related to following libvirt code
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py#L568-L576

Attached is n-cpu.log
title: Detaching iscsi lvm block volumes fails to remove luns on nova cpu host

comments.content:
On kilo master detaching iscsi lvm block volumes fails to remove luns on nova cpu host

How to reproduce with lvm backend
Ubuntu 14.04
clone devstack 
Create volume1_lvm volume type lvmdriver-1
Attach volume1_lvm to nova nst1
ll /dev/disk/by-path/
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root   9 Mar  4 12:59 ip-10.50.128.22:3260-iscsi-iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-45451822-f305-406c-9eec-088b7e432af5-lun-1 -> ../../sdg

Dettach volume1_lvm
ll /dev/disk/by-path/
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root   9 Mar  4 12:59 ip-10.50.128.22:3260-iscsi-iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-45451822-f305-406c-9eec-088b7e432af5-lun-1 -> ../../sdg

Seems to related to following libvirt code
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py#L568-L576

Attached is n-cpu.log
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~michael-denny

comments.content:
The libvirt iSCSI volume driver isn't removing the volume from /dev/disk/by-path before testing to see if it needs to get removed.


The os-brick project has already fixed this logic.

https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/initiator/connector.py#L391-L403
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~walter-boring

comments.content: I think we should check if this bug can still be reproduced. Looks like is-brick has fixed the common cases. There is work to save more in cinder to avoid more complex issues, but I think that is unrelated here.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content: [Expired for OpenStack Compute (nova) because there has been no activity for 60 days.]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~janitor
